name: TAAM App
overview: A database management android app proposed to the <https://www.taam.ca/|Toronto Asian Art Museum> to proper cataloguing of artifacts. Features include viewing, insertion, deletion, look-ups, printing, and more. Aside from the technology, this project was made with several software practices such as SCRUM for collaboration and Mockito for testing. <https://github.com/zsspan/|Zohair>, one of my group mates, made a much more detailed description of the project in his repo which is linked below.

name: Tetris
overview: An implementation of the classic game Tetris developed with <https://github.com/andyliang222|Andy Liang>. As you can imagine, coding this in MIPS Assembly was challenging and frustrating to debug. Plus the fact that we had to collaborate on a SINGLE file since assembly does not support modules. Thank goodness for high-level programming languages, but it's nice to know your roots. You can use <https://courses.missouristate.edu/KenVollmar/MARS/index.htm|MARS> to run this program, make sure to read the comments at the top of tetris.asm for proper setup.

name: OMORI
overview:
A remake of the popular RPG game OMORI made by Orion Chen and <https://github.com/niiicky|Nicky Lam>. This game is a 2D adventure game where you must explore your surroundings to proceed in the story. You will be controlling a character who is named SUNNY located in WHITESPACE and need to find a way to start the game. Once you begin the game, you are now a delusion of SUNNY named OMORI. Hover the lightbulb in the main menu for an easter egg. 

Dedicated to Ms. Wong.

name: Bookshelf
overview: A hackathon project that simply queries a search for a book from the <https://openlibrary.org/|Open Library API> and allows you to add it to a reading list. Original idea was to allow users to share their reading lists by making accounts, but got cut short when <https://github.com/andyliang222|Andy Liang> gave up. Perhaps I'll finish it for him in the future.

name: UNDERTALE
overview:
A budget remake of the popular RPG <https://undertale.com/|UNDERTALE> by Toby Fox made by Orion Chen and <https://github.com/niiicky|Nicky Lam>. In this game you can walk around and interact with certain spots to collect items. When you walk to the end, you will fight a boss fight that features 2 different attacks in the same UNDERTALE style. Do note that the animations such as walking are much more laggy since this was our first experience of making a sandbox game. Our next project OMORI is a much smoother implementation of these animations.

Dedicated to Mr. Chow

name: Stacker
overview:
The first ever game that I made: Stacker, the classic game you see at any arcade. In collaboration with Jacky Men, this game offers two modes which are classic and endless. In the endless mode, you have the ability to use powerups which include doubling score, slowing down the next block, and growing piece you need to stack by one. The full rules are in the RULES tab on the home page. There also is a text file that tracks and displays the local highscore. There's an easter egg in the About section. 

Dedicated to Ms. Wong
